definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: He is determined to devote his life to sicence.
sentences.chinese: 他决心把毕生精力贡献给科学事业。

sentences.english: To love oneself is the beginning o...
sentences.chinese: 爱自己是一场毕生浪漫的开始。

sentences.english: Instead, he devoted his life to jurisprudence and moral philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 而是将毕生精力献给了法学和道德哲学。

sentences.english: I think of Nelson Mandela, who has spent his life upholding the rights of others.
sentences.chinese: 我认为纳尔逊曼德拉，她用毕生维护他人的权利。

sentences.english: It's small kindnesses like that of the Headmaster that you never forget.
sentences.chinese: 而校长那时的亲切关怀，我毕生难忘。

sentences.english: Premier Zhou En- lai worked hard all his life in behalf of the Chinese revolution.
sentences.chinese: 周恩来总理毕生为中国革命鞠躬尽瘁。

sentences.english: He devotes himself to relieving the distressed.
sentences.chinese: 他把毕生精力贡献给医学研究工作。

sentences.english: The image embodied in these names is usually the spirit which the literati pursues in their whole life.
sentences.chinese: 室名别号所蕴含的意象，往往是文人毕生精神的寄托。

sentences.english: Zhou was committed to the cause of language teaching all his life.
sentences.chinese: 周教授将毕生经历都献身于语言教育事业。

sentences.english: Why engage in a deep and lifelong commitment to the principle and the goal of individual liberty?
sentences.chinese: 为什么要对个人自由的原则和目标作出毕生的承诺？
要准备好一份毕生的事业。

sentences.english: The Transcendentalists believed in a process of lifelong spiritual growth.
sentences.chinese: 先验论者坚信毕生的心灵成长过程。

sentences.english: When it comes to education, the majority of people believe that education is a lifetime abstraction.
sentences.chinese: 说到教导，大部门人以为其是一个毕生的学习。

sentences.english: Waite spent his life on a spiritual quest .
sentences.chinese: 韦特毕生都在进行精神探索。

sentences.english: She spent her lief campaigning for women's rights.
sentences.chinese: 她毕生致力于女权运动。

sentences.english: Eg: The old man dedicated his life to science.
sentences.chinese: 那位老人毕生致力于科学事业。

definition: to do all one can/to give all one has
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
life (a person's whole life)/in one's entire life
to empty one's pocket/to give everything to help sb
lit. diligent and never slacking (idiom); continuous concentrated effort/assiduous (in study)/to concentrate
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to make painstaking efforts (idiom); after much trouble/to work hard at sth
